content.question: The experimental rate law for the reaction represented above is <math alttext="rate equals, k times the molar concentration of H 2, times the molar concentration of, N O, end molar concentration, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>r</mtext><mtext>a</mtext><mtext>t</mtext><mtext>e</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>=</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>k</mi><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mtext>H</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub><mtext>]</mtext><msup><mrow><mo>[</mo><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>O</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Which of the following proposed mechanisms is consistent with the rate law?

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
